tw.funymph.commons.sort

Class SortDescriptors<InputType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tw.funymph.commons.sort.SortDescriptors<InputType>
  • Type Parameters:
    InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted

    public class SortDescriptors<InputType>
extends Object
    This class provides a set of methods to organize sort descriptors together to sort elements.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pin-Ying Tu

      • startWith

        public static <InputType> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(SortDescriptor<InputType> descriptor)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap the given sort descriptor as the first descriptor.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the first sort descriptor
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • startWith

        public static <InputType,T extends Comparable<T>> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(Transformer<InputType,T> transformer)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap the given transformer as the first sort descriptor to sort elements ascending.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        T - the type of the input's property to be sorted
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer to be the first sort descriptor
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • startWith

        public static <InputType,T extends Comparable<T>> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(Transformer<InputType,T> transformer,
                                                                       boolean ascending)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap the given transformer as the first sort descriptor.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        T - the type of the input's property to be sorted
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer to be the first sort descriptor
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • startWith

        public static <InputType> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(String propertyName)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements ascending based on the property name as the first sort descriptor.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

        public static <InputType> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(String propertyName,
                                               boolean ascending)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements based on the property name as the first sort descriptor.

        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • startWith

        public static <InputType> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(String propertyName,
                                               String methodPrefix,
                                               boolean ascending)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements based on the property name as the first sort descriptor. The name of the getter method can be customized by the methodPrefix.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        methodPrefix - the customized getter method prefix
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • startWith

        public static <InputType> SortDescriptors<InputType> startWith(String propertyName,
                                               boolean isBooleanProperty,
                                               boolean ascending)
        Create a SortDescriptorsBuilder instance and wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements based on the property name as the first sort descriptor. If the isBooleanProperty is true, the getter prefix will use is instead of get.
        Type Parameters:
        InputType - the type of the elements to be sorted
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        isBooleanProperty - to indicate whether the property is boolean property
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • thenWith

        public SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(SortDescriptor<InputType> descriptor)
        Add the given sort descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the sort descriptor
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • thenWith

        public <T extends Comparable<T>> SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(Transformer<InputType,T> transformer)
        Wrap the given transformer as a sort descriptor to sort elements ascending.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the input's property to be sorted
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer to be the sort descriptor
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • thenWith

        public <T extends Comparable<T>> SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(Transformer<InputType,T> transformer,
                                                            boolean ascending)
        Wrap the given transformer as a first sort descriptor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the input's property to be sorted
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer to be the sort descriptor
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

        public SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(String propertyName)
        Wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements ascending based on the property name.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • thenWith

        public SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(String propertyName,
                                  boolean ascending)

        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending

      • thenWith

        public SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(String propertyName,
                                  boolean isBooleanProperty,
                                  boolean ascending)
        Wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements based on the property name. If the isBooleanProperty is true, the getter prefix will use is instead of get.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        isBooleanProperty - to indicate whether the property is boolean property
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors

      • thenWith

        public SortDescriptors<InputType> thenWith(String propertyName,
                                  String methodPrefix,
                                  boolean ascending)
        Wrap a sort descriptor to sort elements based on the property name as. The name of the getter method can be customized by the methodPrefix.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to sort
        methodPrefix - the customized getter method prefix
        ascending - to sort elements ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the builder to organize other sort descriptors
